# iosxr_cli_alias (Resource)

This resource can manage the CLI Alias configuration.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "iosxr_cli_alias" "example" {
  aliases = [
    {
      name    = "show-version"
      command = "show version"
    }
  ]
  exec_aliases = [
    {
      name    = "sv"
      command = "show version"
    }
  ]
  config_aliases = [
    {
      name    = "int-config"
      command = "interface GigabitEthernet0/0/0/0"
    }
  ]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `aliases` (Attributes List) Alias name (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--aliases))
- `config_aliases` (Attributes List) Config Alias name (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--config_aliases))
- `delete_mode` (String) Configure behavior when deleting/destroying the resource. Either delete the entire object (YANG container) being managed, or only delete the individual resource attributes configured explicitly and leave everything else as-is. Default value is `all`.
  - Choices: `all`, `attributes`
- `device` (String) A device name from the provider configuration.
- `exec_aliases` (Attributes List) Exec Alias name (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--exec_aliases))

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The path of the object.

<a id="nestedatt--aliases"></a>
### Nested Schema for `aliases`

Required:

- `command` (String) Alias body with optional parameters e.g,(name) show $name
- `name` (String) Alias name


<a id="nestedatt--config_aliases"></a>
### Nested Schema for `config_aliases`

Required:

- `command` (String) Aliased config command
- `name` (String) Config Alias name


<a id="nestedatt--exec_aliases"></a>
### Nested Schema for `exec_aliases`

Required:

- `command` (String) Aliased exec command
- `name` (String) Exec Alias name

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
terraform import iosxr_cli_alias.example ""
```
